contextId.information: The ordinal numbers can be translated as cardinal numbers. AT: "They had lived in the wilderness for 40 years, 11 months, and 1 day, when Moses spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
contextId.quote: It happened in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spoke

contextId.information: "7th day." Here "seventh" is the ordinal number for seven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"7th year." This "seventh" is the ordinal number for seven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This "first" is the ordinal number for one. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This "tenth" is the ordinal number for ten. AT: "even after ten generations of the illegitimate child's descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
contextId.quote: as far as to the tenth generation of his descendants

contextId.information: This "third" is the ordinal number for three. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "If an Edomite or an Egyptian comes to live in the Israelite community, his grandchildren may become full members of that community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The descendants of the third generation that are born to them may belong to the assembly of Yahweh
